name: Vegan Fettuccine Alfredo with Mushrooms. Nut-free
description: The Best Vegan Mushroom Garlic Alfredo with No Nuts. Garlicky, Creamy, Amazing Vegan Fettuccine Alfredo. Easily Gluten-free, soy-free. Nut-free Vegan Alfredo Healthy Recipe. 21 gm of protein per serving!

Vegan Mushroom Garlic Alfredo with Pepitas or Cashews. 
RECIPE: http://www.veganricha.com/2017/08/vegan-fettuccine-alfredo-with-mushrooms-nut-free.html

How to make Garlicky, Creamy, Amazing Vegan Fettuccine Alfredo with Caramelized Mushrooms and onions. Nut-free, Easily Gluten-free, soy-free. 21 gm of protein per serving

recipeIngredient: 8 oz mushrooms (white or a mix of white, cremini, portobello)
1 tbsp  or more dry white wine
1 tbsp vegan worcestershire sauce (or use 2 tsp soy sauce (coconut aminos for soyfree), 1/2 tsp apple cider vinegar, 1/2 tsp molasses)
1/4 tsp or more red pepper flakes
1 cup cauliflower florets (heaping cup of florets)
2 tbsp hemp seeds or pumpkin seeds (, or use raw cashews (soaked) for even more creamier)
1/2 tsp dried basil or a handful of fresh

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion, garlic, mushrooms and a good pinch of salt and cook until golden. Add the wine, sauce and pepper flakes and cook for half a minute.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion, garlic, mushrooms and a good pinch of salt and cook until golden. Add the wine, sauce and pepper flakes and cook for half a minute.

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large wide pot of water to a boil. Add the fettuccine and cook for 3 minutes. Mix. Add the cauliflower and potatoes on top of the pasta and continue to cook for 5 to 6 minutes or until the pasta is cooked to preference. *See note
recipeInstructions.name: Bring a large wide pot of water to a boil. Add the fettuccine and cook for 3 minutes. Mix. Add the cauliflower and potatoes on top of the pasta and continue to cook for 5 to 6 minutes or until the pasta is cooked to preference. *See note

recipeInstructions.text: Drain, rinse in cold water. Remove the cauliflower and potato and Transfer the to a blender.
recipeInstructions.name: Drain, rinse in cold water. Remove the cauliflower and potato and Transfer the to a blender.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the rest of the alfredo ingredients to the blender. Add 2 tbsp of the mushroom onion mixture and blend until smooth. Blend for a minute, then rest for a minute and blend again.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the rest of the alfredo ingredients to the blender. Add 2 tbsp of the mushroom onion mixture and blend until smooth. Blend for a minute, then rest for a minute and blend again.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour sauce into the mushroom skillet and cook over medium heat to bring to a boil to thicken. Taste and adjust salt and flavor. If the sauce thickens too much, add in some more water or non dairy milk. Mix in the fettuccine and serve. Alternatively, plate the fettuccine and drizzle the sauce generously and serve. Garnish with basil and pepper and optionally Vegan Parm.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour sauce into the mushroom skillet and cook over medium heat to bring to a boil to thicken. Taste and adjust salt and flavor. If the sauce thickens too much, add in some more water or non dairy milk. Mix in the fettuccine and serve. Alternatively, plate the fettuccine and drizzle the sauce generously and serve. Garnish with basil and pepper and optionally Vegan Parm.
